com.erikartymiuk.badbudgetlogic.main

Class Prediction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.erikartymiuk.badbudgetlogic.main.Prediction

  • public class Prediction
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class used for the predict feature of BadBudget. This class is a static class which primary method is the "predict" method which given the users data, current date, and a target date will populate the user objects predict data so that all days between current and target are populated with correct values.

    • Method Detail

      • predict

        public static void predict(BadBudgetData currentUserValues,
                           java.util.Date currentDate,
                           java.util.Date targetDate)
        Main method for the prediction class. Static method that will populate all the user objects with correct values for days between currentDate and targetDate. A new call to predict using a previously used budget data object refreshes the predict data lists of the corresponding bad budget data objects. To continue a previous call without recalculating all previous dates call the predictContinue method. This method should not be called if the prediction data is planning to be used to update the base bbd objects. (call update instead). The order objects are handled on each day is defined as: Contributions Gains Debts Losses Budget
        Parameters:
        currentUserValues - - All of the user's current accounts to be used and have their predict data populated
        currentDate - - The day the user's data is on (should be the current day)
        targetDate - - Any day past currentDate that the user would like to know what their accounts value is on that day.

      • predictContinue

        public static void predictContinue(BadBudgetData currentUserValues,
                                   java.util.Date originalStart,
                                   java.util.Date lastTarget,
                                   java.util.Date newTarget)
        An additional prediction method used to continue a previous predict (or predict continue) call without recalculating all the computation already done. Given the original bounds and a new target this predict picks up where a previous call to predict or predictContinue left off, populating the prediction rows for all the bbd objects up to and including the newTarget date. Note this should not be called for updating the base bbd objects, rather call a single update.
        Parameters:
        currentUserValues - - the bad budget data that has already been populated by a previous call to predict or predict continue
        originalStart - - the original start date passed to the initial predict call.
        lastTarget - - the date we have prediction data up to already from previous calls to predict and/or predict continue
        newTarget - - the date we would like to continue the prediction up to now.

      • addDays

        Adds the given number of days to the given day and returns the resulting Date
        Parameters:

      • datesEqualUpToDay

        public static boolean datesEqualUpToDay(java.util.Date date1,
                                        java.util.Date date2)
        Method to compare two dates and see if they are the same day up to granularity of day. (i.e. hours, minutes, etc. doesn't matter).
        Parameters:
        date1 - - one of the dates to compare
        date2 - - the other date to compare
        Returns:
        boolean - true if the dates are equal up to their days, false otherwise.

      • convertIndexToDate

        public static java.util.Date convertIndexToDate(java.util.Date startDate,
                                                int index)
        Helper method used to convert an index in the prediction list to a date Needs to know the start date to work from. The date returned is truncated, i.e its granularity is only the day of the year.
        Parameters:
        startDate - - the date to add the index to
        index - - the index to convert to a date
        Returns:
        - returns the Date that the index (using the startDate) refers to

      • numDaysBetween

        public static int numDaysBetween(java.util.Date day1,
                                 java.util.Date day2)
        Helper method to find the number of days between two dates, after truncating the dates to be 00:00. Can be used to check if one date occurs before the other (up to the day) by checking for >,<, = to zero
        Parameters:
        day1 - - the sooner date
        day2 - - the later date
        Returns:
        int - the number of days between the two dates (if days apart greater than int behavior undefined)

      • findGoalDate

        public static java.util.Date findGoalDate(java.util.Date nextContribution,
                                          Contribution contribution,
                                          double currentAmount,
                                          double goalAmount)
        Given the next contribution date, recurring contribution (amount and frequency that is not one time), goal amount, and current amount this method calculates what end date would have us reaching the goal amount.
        Parameters:
        nextContribution - - the date the next contribution occurs adding to the current amount
        contribution - - the contribution to consider in reaching the goal (frequency must be recurring, undefined if not)
        currentAmount - - the starting amount
        goalAmount - - the goal amount
        Returns:
        Date - the day we reach or overreach our goal amount

      • findPaymentAmountCompoundInterest

        public static double findPaymentAmountCompoundInterest(java.util.Date startDate,
                                                       int daysBeforeFirstPayment,
                                                       java.util.Date goalDate,
                                                       Frequency freq,
                                                       double debtAmount,
                                                       double interestRate)
        Finds the necessary payment amount to pay the debt down to zero by the goal date taking into account interest that compounds daily
        Parameters:
        startDate - - the date of the first payment
        daysBeforeFirstPayment - - the days remaining prior to the first payment where interest can accumulate
        goalDate - - the date we want our debt to be 0
        freq - - the frequency of our payment
        debtAmount - - the starting value of our debt
        interestRate - - the interest rate of our debt
        Returns:
        - the payment amount required to pay this debt down to 0 by the goal date

      • findContributionAmount

        public static double findContributionAmount(java.util.Date startDate,
                                            java.util.Date nextContribution,
                                            Frequency contributionFreq,
                                            double currentAmount,
                                            double goalAmount,
                                            double interestRate,
                                            java.util.Date goalDate)
        Finds the needed regular contribution amount to hit a goal by the requested goal date taking into account the expected return rate.
        Parameters:
        startDate - - the date interest can start to accumulate on the savings. Will be the first of the next month when it begins
        nextContribution - - the initial contribution date
        contributionFreq - - the contribution frequency
        currentAmount - - the current amount in the savings account
        goalAmount - - the goal amount
        interestRate - - the interest rate
        goalDate - - the goal date we would like to hit
        Returns:
        the needed contribution amount to hit our goal amount by the goal date

      • findGoalAmount

        public static double findGoalAmount(java.util.Date startDate,
                                    java.util.Date nextContribution,
                                    Contribution contribution,
                                    double currentAmount,
                                    double interestRate,
                                    java.util.Date goalDate)
        Find the goal amount given the goalDate and contribution. Takes into account interest accumulation.
        Parameters:
        startDate - - the date to begin considering interest accumulation. Will begin on the first of the next month
        nextContribution - - the date of the first regular contribution
        contribution - - the regular contribution
        currentAmount - - the initial amount
        interestRate - - the expected interest rate
        goalDate - - the goal date where we stop contributions
        Returns:
        - the goal amount

      • findGoalDateWithInterest

        public static java.util.Date findGoalDateWithInterest(java.util.Date startDate,
                                                      java.util.Date nextContribution,
                                                      Contribution contribution,
                                                      double currentAmount,
                                                      double goalAmount,
                                                      double interestRate,
                                                      java.util.Date goalLimit)
        Calculates the goal date of a savings account with a contribution and interest accumulation
        Parameters:
        startDate - - the start date to use for the initial interest accumulation
        nextContribution - - the first contribution date
        contribution - - the contribution amount and frequency
        currentAmount - - the current amount in the savings account
        goalAmount - - the goal amount
        interestRate - - the expected interest rate return of the savings account
        goalLimit - - the goal date limit, set to null if no limit is to be considered (can result in infinite loop)
        Returns:
        the goal date if found when the goal amount is reached or null if the goal date is not found before hitting the limit set.

      • findInterestEarned

        public static double findInterestEarned(java.util.Date startDate,
                                        java.util.Date nextContribution,
                                        Contribution contribution,
                                        double currentAmount,
                                        double goalAmount,
                                        double interestRate,
                                        java.util.Date goalLimit)
        Calculates the interest earned on a savings account with interest accumulation given the goal amount that is trying to be reached.
        Parameters:
        startDate - - the date to start consideration of interest accumulation. Interest accrues every month starting the 1st of the next month after the start month
        nextContribution - - the date of the first contribution
        contribution - - the contribution amount and frequency
        currentAmount - - the current amount of this savings account
        goalAmount - - the goal amount
        interestRate - - the interest rate of the savings account
        goalLimit - - the limit that we should stop searching for a goal at (or null if no limit is to be considered)
        Returns:
        the interest accrued in reaching the goal amount or -1 if the goal amount isn't reached by the limit.

      • findGoalDate

        public static java.util.Date findGoalDate(java.util.Date startDate,
                                          double paymentAmount,
                                          Frequency freq,
                                          double debtAmount,
                                          java.util.Date goalLimit)
        Deprecated. - use findGoalDateSimpleInterest or findGoalDateCompoundInterest, this method does not take into account the interest rate
        Given a startDate, payment amount and frequency, and the current debt amount, this method finds the date the debt would be reduced to zero
        Parameters:
        startDate -
        paymentAmount -
        freq -
        debtAmount -
        goalLimit - - the date not to look past for our goal or null if no limit should be considered (could result in infinite loop)
        Returns:
        Date - the date the debt would be reduced to zero, or null if not found before the goal limit set

      • findSimpleInterestPaid

        public static double findSimpleInterestPaid(java.util.Date startDate,
                                            int daysBeforeFirstPayment,
                                            double paymentAmount,
                                            Frequency freq,
                                            double debtAmount,
                                            double interestRate,
                                            double principal,
                                            java.util.Date goalLimit)
        Finds the total interest paid when paying off a loan using the given payment amount and interest rate. If the loan isn't paid off by the goal limit set then this method return -1.
        Parameters:
        startDate - - the date payments begin
        daysBeforeFirstPayment - - the days before the first payment where interest will accrue
        paymentAmount - - the regular payment amount to make
        freq - - the frequency of the payment
        debtAmount - - the amount of the debt (interest and principal)
        interestRate - - the interest rate for the loan
        principal - - the principal amount of the loan (debtAmount - principal is interest)
        goalLimit - - the limit for our goal date (or null if not limit set)
        Returns:
        the interest that will be paid over the paying off of this loan or -1 if it isn't paid off by the limit set.

      • findGoalDateSimpleInterest

        public static java.util.Date findGoalDateSimpleInterest(java.util.Date startDate,
                                                        int daysBeforeFirstPayment,
                                                        double paymentAmount,
                                                        Frequency freq,
                                                        double debtAmount,
                                                        double interestRate,
                                                        double principal,
                                                        java.util.Date goalLimit)
        Calculate a goal date for a simple daily interest loan. If the goal isn't found by the specified limit then this method returns null.
        Parameters:
        startDate - - the date the first payment is made
        daysBeforeFirstPayment - - days before the first payment is made and interest is accumulated on the principal
        paymentAmount - - the amount to make for each payment (first applied to interest then to principal)
        freq - - how often the payment is made
        debtAmount - - the current total amount of the loan debt (principal and interest)
        interestRate - - the interest rate of the loan
        principal - - the principal amount of the loan used to calculate interest from (debt amount - principal is the starting interest)
        goalLimit - - the date not to look past for a goal or null if no limit to be considered
        Returns:
        - the goal date if found before the specified limit or null if not found

      • findCompoundInterestPaid

        public static double findCompoundInterestPaid(java.util.Date startDate,
                                              int daysBeforeFirstPayment,
                                              double paymentAmount,
                                              Frequency freq,
                                              double debtAmount,
                                              double interestRate,
                                              java.util.Date goalLimit)
        Calculates how much would be paid in interest over the life of a loan.
        Parameters:
        startDate - - the first day that a payment will be applied to this debt and begin recurring
        daysBeforeFirstPayment - - the days before the first payment occurs (interest is calculated for each of these days with no payments being applied).
        paymentAmount - - the amount of the payment that is made regularly
        freq - - the frequency of the payment
        debtAmount - - the amount of the debt that we want reduced to zero with our recurring payment
        interestRate - - the interest rate that will be considered in applying interest compounded daily
        goalLimit - - the date not to search past for our goal or null if no limit set
        Returns:
        the interest that will be paid while paying a debt down to 0 or -1 if no goal is found before limit is hit

      • findGoalDateCompoundInterest

        public static java.util.Date findGoalDateCompoundInterest(java.util.Date startDate,
                                                          int daysBeforeFirstPayment,
                                                          double paymentAmount,
                                                          Frequency freq,
                                                          double debtAmount,
                                                          double interestRate,
                                                          java.util.Date goalLimit)
        Calculates when a debt payment will be reduced to zero taking into account interest that is assumed to be compounded daily, and a payment that is being made regularly to the debt. This also assumes that the debt amount is fixed and won't change otherwise the goal date may no longer be valid.
        Parameters:
        startDate - - the first day that a payment will be applied to this debt and begin recurring
        daysBeforeFirstPayment - - the days before the first payment occurs (interest is calculated for each of these days with no payments being applied).
        paymentAmount - - the amount of the payment that is made regularly
        freq - - the frequency of the payment
        debtAmount - - the amount of the debt that we want reduced to zero with our recurring payment
        interestRate - - the interest rate that will be considered in applying interest compounded daily
        goalLimit - - the date not to search past for our goal or null if no limit set
        Returns:
        the date that the debt will be reduced to zero using the payment or null if no goal found before hitting the goal limit

      • toggle

        public static double toggle(double amount,
                            Frequency origFreq,
                            Frequency convertFreq)
        Utility method. Converts the amount at origFreq to a new frequency. Every frequency except for oneTime can be converted from one to another.
        Parameters:
        amount - - the original amount at the original frequency
        origFreq - - the original frequency we are converting from
        convertFreq - - the new frequency we wish to convert to
        Returns:
        double - the new amount at the converted frequency. returns -1 if oneTime is passed as one of the frequencies.

      • analyze1

        public static void analyze1(BadBudgetData data,
                            Frequency freq)

      • update

        public static void update(BadBudgetData bbd,
                          java.util.Date currDate,
                          java.util.Date endDate)
        Runs a prediction from currDate to endDate. Considers remainAmounts if auto reset is on. Uses the results of this prediction to update all of the bbd objects in bbd. Does not clear the prediction data before returning, allowing user access to history up to the update date.
        Parameters:
        bbd - - the objects to run the update on
        currDate - - the start date for our prediction/update (note used by debts for the start date, namely credit cards)
        endDate - - the stopping date (inclusive) for our prediction

      • updateNextDatesOnly

        public static void updateNextDatesOnly(BadBudgetData bbd,
                                       java.util.Date currDate,
                                       java.util.Date endDate)
        Only updates a bbd object's next dates, and also dependent goal dates if necessary. Budget items current amount is set depending on whether autoReset is set in the budget. If not set then the budget items only have their next dates updated. If set then the remain action is considered and the curr amount of the items is updated accordingly.
        Parameters:
        bbd - - the bad budget data to update the next dates for
        currDate - - the date considered as the start
        endDate - - the date to end our update on
